short_description: This function generates combinations of frequent baskets
long_description: This function is used for identifying the associations in two item-set. For every combination, this function generates the score, support, confidence and z-score associated with the combination

argument_clauses.name: Domain
argument_clauses.rDescription: The address of the Queen. The host parameter is the Aster Database Queen’s IP address or hostname.
argument_clauses.description: The address of the Queen. The host parameter is the Aster Database Queen’s IP address or hostname.

argument_clauses.name: Database
argument_clauses.rDescription: The name of the database where the input table is located.
argument_clauses.description: The name of the database where the input table is located.

argument_clauses.name: UserId
argument_clauses.rDescription: The Aster Database user name of the user running this function.
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database user name of the user running this function.

argument_clauses.name: Password
argument_clauses.rDescription: The Aster Database password of the user.
argument_clauses.description: The Aster Database password of the user.

argument_clauses.name: SSLSettings
argument_clauses.rDescription: A string that includes all the SSL settings, except the password for the truststore.
argument_clauses.description: A string that includes all the SSL settings, except the password for the truststore.

argument_clauses.name: SSLTrustStorePassword
argument_clauses.rDescription: The password for the SSL truststore.
argument_clauses.description: The password for the SSL truststore.

argument_clauses.name: InputTable
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the table that contains the data to filter.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the table that contains the data to filter.

argument_clauses.name: OutputTable
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the output table that the function creates. The table must not exist.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the name of the output table that the function creates. The table must not exist.

argument_clauses.name: InputColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input table columns that contain the data to filter.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input table columns that contain the data to filter.

argument_clauses.name: JoinColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input table columns to join.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input table columns to join.

argument_clauses.name: AddColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the input columns to copy to the output table. The function partitions the input data and the output table on these columns. By default, the function treats the input data as belonging to one partition. Note: Specifying a column as both an add_column and a join_column causes incorrect counts in partitions.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the input columns to copy to the output table. The function partitions the input data and the output table on these columns. By default, the function treats the input data as belonging to one partition. Note: Specifying a column as both an add_column and a join_column causes incorrect counts in partitions.

argument_clauses.name: PartitionKey
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the output column to use as the partition key. The default value is 'col1_item1'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the output column to use as the partition key. The default value is 'col1_item1'.

argument_clauses.name: MaxItemSet
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the maximum size of the item set. The default value is 100.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the maximum size of the item set. The default value is 100.

argument_clauses.name: DropTable
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to drop the output table if it exists. The default value is 'false'.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies whether to drop the output table if it exists. The default value is 'false'.
